goals.question: What is the distribution of movie ratings?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of movie ratings and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between movie budget and revenue?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of movie budget vs revenue
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a correlation between movie budget and revenue, and if higher budgets lead to higher revenues.

goals.question: What is the most common genre of movies in the dataset?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify the most common genres of movies in the dataset and understand the distribution of genres.

goals.question: What is the distribution of movie runtimes?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of movie runtimes and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the distribution of movie release years?
goals.visualization: Line chart of movie release years
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of movie release years and identify any trends over time.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='rating', bins=20, kde=True, color='blue')
    median_rating = data['rating'].median()
    plt.axvline(median_rating, color='red', linestyle='--', label=f'Median: {median_rating:.2f}')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of movie ratings?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Movie Ratings')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='budget', y='revenue')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between movie budget and revenue?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    genre_counts = data['genre'].value_counts()
    sns.barplot(x=genre_counts.index, y=genre_counts.values, palette='viridis')
    plt.xlabel('Genres')
    plt.ylabel('Number of Movies')
    plt.title('What is the most common genre of movies in the dataset?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.legend(genre_counts.index, title='Genres', loc='upper right')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='runtime', bins=30, color='blue', kde=True)
    median_runtime = data['runtime'].median()
    plt.axvline(median_runtime, color='red', linestyle='--', label=f'Median Runtime: {median_runtime:.2f}')
    plt.xlabel('Movie Runtimes')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of movie runtimes?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['release_year'] = pd.to_datetime(data['release_date'], errors='coerce').dt.year
    data = data[pd.notna(data['release_year'])]
    data['release_year'] = data['release_year'].astype(int)

    plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='release_year', kde=True, bins=30, color='blue')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of movie release years?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Release Year')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.legend(['Density'])

    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
